instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
This one turns off and magsafe light goes green when you tap the power button. I have tried a good keyboard.

Any suggestions?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: Realy?? Thats all? no history, no measurments, no tests.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
This one had liquid but board looks clean no corrosion. There is PP3v42 and <SIGNAL>KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes low with power button. This is a 2015 so no ASD. Is there measurements or test you would like me to run/take that would help you understand what could be the problem. The machine seems to function fine other than the power button issue.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: the basics, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, green/orange light, this board should turn on just by pluging in charger, so forget about power button for now, the fan will not spin untill the processor gets really hot, so forget about fan spin.. CPU Vcore present??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: SMC reset is triggered when you hit the power button. Check corrosion around <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>.
